mflorea - (14:20): sdumitriu: two questions if you have a minute. (1) I see doc id changes with doc rename. Is there some unique id that identifies a documents across rename or move? (2) xwikircs table has a xwr\_patch field but afaics it contains the full XML serialization of the document. Is that true?  
sdumitriu - (14:21): 1 no  
sdumitriu - (14:21): 2 not really  
sdumitriu - (14:22): One in every N versions stores the full XML  
mflorea - (14:22): re (1). $doc.id changes, I just tested  
sdumitriu - (14:22): Yes, it changes.  
mflorea - (14:22): ah  
sdumitriu - (14:22): No = There's no unique ID  
mflorea - (14:22): :(  
sdumitriu - (14:22): Yet  
mflorea - (14:22): :)  
sdumitriu - (14:23): We should introduce a GUID, like we have for objects  
sdumitriu - (14:23): And move names to a different table, and allow several names for the same document  
sdumitriu - (14:24): For (2), this was done as a balance between size and speed  
mflorea - (14:24): I remember the discussions  
sdumitriu - (14:24): Since computing a specific version requires loading all the patches to it and applying them in order  
mflorea - (14:24): re (2) how is the patch created when I change the value of a property?  
sdumitriu - (14:24): So instead of going from the start to the required version, we go to the nearest full XML

sdumitriu - (14:25): Basic diff between the full XML export of the document

mflorea - (14:25): ah  
mflorea - (14:25): I understand  
mflorea - (14:26): thanks Sergiu
